body.p:
Maysville Ky: Jany 9th 1863.
To his Excellency
James F. Robinson

We wish to represent to you, that Mr Erastus Lambden of our City was fined $50. for suffering a game of recre ^seven up^ to be played at his house between Mr Newell and Mr Houghey for a quarter of a dollar.

Mr Lambden keeps a saloon in our Town and Haughey came in for a drink proposing that he could win his quarter at the first game -- Mr Lambden did not accept the proposition, but, Mr Newall played and won! Haughey became angry and said that he would have Lambden fined to the extent of the law and procurred a warrant from our Mayor, who fined him $50. Haughey proposed that if Lambden would pay him $50. that he would have the prosecution dismissed. Lambden replevied the fine and a day or two since paid it. We think
that he should be releived of it, and ask your Excellency to have it remitted.

Unquestionably, from information given you, it seems to be malice on the part of Haughey to have Mr Lambden fined. Mr Lambden has paid the debt, yet, we think that it is a great imposition, and therefore make this appeal to his behalf.
Accompanying this petition is the Affidavit of Mr Lambden as well as that of Mr Newell.

R, H, Stanton
Thos J Throop

Pettn of Maysville Citizens to remit fine of E Lamden
Fine within case remitted all except Ten dollars 5th Feby 1863
